I'm not too fussy but sleeping in it caused the underneath mattress to be exposed (kind of yuck) skill up the workers!!! - Elevator gives me the creeps (not good for people with height phobias) - Looking outside on the roof you can see millions of cigarette butts (come on just get a broom) - Noisy aircon - Noisy Fridge - Useless Fridge (doesnt cool very well) - Bible had torn pages, not that I care so much but some people may find this offensive. Workers should check after guests leave. - A final note although this could be me, My eyes were very irritated after sleeping on the pillows. What kind of cleaning chemicals do you guys use? I never had this before??!! I didnt try the food simply because the place was so dirty I could imagine the kitchen could be 10x worse. To management: at least fix the above so that people can have a good "clean" impression and perhaps then it would do well for your business. Overall I give it 2 stars. One for the parking and one for the no fuss booking. I spent the other 2 nights of my trip elsewhere... To be honest I read the reviews before choosing Rydges but I had no choice but to sleep there for two nights because of location/availability of rooms in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: JetVortex
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when I read the reviews. But was very happy with what we had. We booked the Zoo package in a 2 bedroom "suite". There were 5 of us including 3 children. My wife and I do stay in 4* and 5* hotels a couple of times a year. The hotel was clean, staff were very friendly and helpful on check-in and check-out. Breakfast, well it wasn't 5* but everyone ate everything and there were no complaints, it was fresh and there was plenty of it. The room and the hotel are looking a little tired, they have tried to refresh the areas but really it was fine, we went to Carols in the Domain, where can you stay in Sydney with 2 adults, 2 teens and 1 child, get a bed each, full buffet breakfast, parking, (entry to the zoo which alone would have cost $142.00) and a pretty decent view for a total package price of $300.00. If you and the family want a weekend away, try this zoo package, it is good value, but have your expectations set at hotel of 3.5*.

Reviews.Title: “Rydges North Sydney - Average to Poor at everything they do.....”
Reviews.Author: GlobalCitizen01
Reviews.Content: I stay at Rydges Nth Sydney for several weeks a year as it is right next door to my company head office. If it was not for this convinience I would not bother. If you are happy with mediocrity at best at everything they do, then you'll be ok here. I mean the rooms are comfy enough, the price is ok, and if you need a Nth Sydney location then its located just fine. But thats all its got going for it. The restaurant and bar have just had a spruce up, its now called Mundos. The service and food is stil crap though. The food is really inconsistent. It rarely comes as described in the menu and if you can get a steak cooked how you ask for you are doing better than me. My biggest gripe is house keeping. Their ability to clean a room is appaling. Tea/coffee/milk are rarely topped up more than once or twice a week. The bathrooms are old and mouldy. Rubbish bins are rarely emptied. Rarely is every facet of the room attended to in a daily visit from housekeeping. Reception staff are inefficient, unprofessional and simply "average". Big TV's, comfy beds are pluses. Maybe I expect to much from a hotel of this class/price? If it wasn't next to my office I wouldn't bother. I don't bother eating here anymore, I order delivery from one of Nth Sydneys great range of places or wander down the road to one of the great cafes or restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: midwicket
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the North Sydney Rydges and was really impressed with all facets of my stay. The rooms were a nice size with LCD tv. The beds are one of the best beds I've ever stayed in (inc Sheraton and Crown Towers). Staff were extremely helpful and the area around the hotel was nice and quiet. Perfect for a good rest.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel package that was paid by my work, that I'm glad I didn't have to pay for”
Reviews.Author: fences4u
Reviews.Content: We are pretty average easy going people, this trip was paid by my employer as a bonus but I got to pick where we were to stay. I chose the family taronga zoo/luna park package, as we googled and found this package and thought it seemed pretty reasonable value for money and a good family trip away for the weekend. The following is our feedback for the two night period of stay- *We went to the room with the key card obtained by reception and the door wouldn't unlock. I went back to reception and lady began to say "how" to put the card in (i guess thinking we did it incorrectly) I told her I did it correctly. I went back up to the room after she had reset the code and it still didn't work! I went back down and saw another lady and she said it had a block on it ? She removed this block. I went back up and it worked. *You may find the lift a problem at certain time frames. Most of the time we found it was quite slow. There was one instance that we were trying to get to breakfast and were waiting for the lift for a minimun of 15 minutes and it still didn't come! so we decided to take the stairs but this is a problem as when you get to the only door below level 1 it has a sign, saying the door is alarmed? So we went back up to level 1 and waited another 10 minutes and finally got the lift. I can appreciate times can get busy but surely there should be another option instead of the lift that can get you to the ground level without any hassle? *The sliding door to the balcony didn't slide very well. maybe needs needs new rollers? or maybe this was to stop any kids going onto the balcony as the door didn't have a lock - we have two children aged 9 & 6? *The bedroom lights didn't work. *The bathroom fan was constanly on. *The shower has a mind of it's own, the hot water plays up and on 2 occasions had no water at all with both taps full on - not fantastic when you are half way through your shower with a head full of shampoo trying to rinse it off!!!. *It was ironic that at one stage we were in the lift with another family and the husband said how good the breakfast was and the wife commented about the "noisy sheets" , this was after my wife saying the same thing prior. It didn't worry me but my wife said every movement was like a rolling in leaves sound. Also the actual dooner cover were just sheets covering it no actual cover. I suppose this might be quicker for cleaning? *My wife was dissapointed that she had brought her own hair dryer as there was already one in the room. She went to use the one in the room and it worked but the only disapointment was the thick film of dust entailed. *As part of the room package we ordered three beers on ice.This is correct it was only on ice with very minimal ice around the actual beer, so beer wasn't very cold. So no worries I went to the fridge and it was the same sort of temperature as fridge turned to lowest setting(I suppose to save power?)- Freezer was good to cool drinks! *The breakfast was part of the package and I was ok with it, the only grief was with the bacon. When the bacon was changed with new, they left the left over oil in the tray which was quite substantial. Maybee drain the oil before putting in the new? *The car park only has limited numbers, you are not assured of a spot. There are some limited ones outside and not part of the complex. You don't need to pay for these on weekends and after 6.pm and before 8.am Weekdays but there is a 2 hour limit parking limit during 8.pm to 6.pm. *I hope this helps for future improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone said”
Reviews.Author: 7DC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges World Square for business a few days earlier and chose Rydges North Sydney for a week-end break with my wife. I must say I had some reservations after reading all the bad reviews on this site about the hotel and considering how good World Square was. We took the train from the airport to North Sydney station and walked from there to the hotel. It was a bit of a hike uphill but we were there within 15 minutes (it took 10 minutes after that as we knew exactly how to get there). You could also take one of many buses from the station/shopping centre and it's two stops from there on Miller Street. Our first interaction with the staff was to leave our luggage with the hotel so we could go out and explore Sydney. The lady who wrked there that morning wasn't particularly welcoming but I wouldn't say she was rude, just dry. When we came back in the afternoon, the male staff was much more welcoming and we were given a room on a high floor. OK, so the room is a bit tired (ie. carpet and furniture need a makeover) and the window seal wasn't working well when the wind was blowing hard at night. But apart from that, there was nothing else we would complain about. It was a clean hotel room and the bed was comfortable. As it was not in the centre of the CBD, we had to plan our days out carefully as we just couldn't come back when we felt like it but there are enough cafÃ©s, parks and shopping centres in town to have a breather when you felt like it. On our last night, we went to the Rag & Famin pub nearby (200metres) and had their famous 'crusty lid pies' for dinner. There are a lot of restaurants in Crows Nest and that's a $7 taxi ride or a few bus stops on the Pacific Highway. So, overall, it was a comfortable and pleasant stay. I guess the reviews prepared us for the worst and it wasn't that bad after all. It's also good to stay outside of the city every now and then.

Reviews.Title: “Amateur hour, location is it's only strength - POOR”
Reviews.Author: Montza
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel 2-4 days a week for nearly 8 months, I cannot believe how many mistakes and total lack of interest in the customer a hotel can have. Each time I booked it was like I was a first time guest, there is a farcicle 2.5% credit card fee (who pays cash!), the rooms have been 'refreshed' but sort-of like putting a few new furniture items amongst the golden oldies in your Grandparents 70's lounge room. Rooms have Queen size beds (including the 1 bedroom suites), facilities in the rooms are at best mediocre - as other reviews have called out, there are new LCD TVs, but that's where anything modern ends. The clock-radios in the bedheads look like something out of a 70's erotica film! There is no pool or gym facilties, the bar is painfully boring and the restaurant serves credible breakfast buffet/coffee - but I wasn't game enough to dine there even once in my regular stays over 8 months. There is ample car parking (for a fee), so if you're on a driving holiday or working on the road, I guess that's a strength. Obvious question - Why did I stay there for 8mo if it was so bad? Answer. Location/proximity to my office, it was summer so I could exercise outdoors (gym wasn't an issue) and at the time the rate on offer for corporate guests went a way to justifying the place. On the price front, whilst the rooms are often available at competitive prices, the Rydges model is comparable to Formule 1 hotels - EVERYTHING extra comes at a cost. Internet is exorbitantly priced at ~$25 a day, mini-bar is more expensive that a coke at the movie theatre - generally, what you save in room rate, they'll try get back from you somewhere else. To be perfectly honest, the best summary I can give of this place is that it is the [maybe] the best choice of 3 large hotels in North Sydney, and don't they know it... Save yourself the pain, stay in the CBD and cop the cab fare across the bridge - the $15 taxi is definitely worth it! Barely a pulse...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: angel_star_charlie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married here in October 2006 and decided to return recently for a romantic night away. This place has really gone down hill since we last visited and was a big disappointment for us. Renovations are currently taking place in the retaurant/bar area which makes for a very unattractive entrance. Staff on reception were rude and unhelpful, room was clean and most things seemed to work although the bathroom could do with a makeover and a proper clean. I made the mistake of leaving behind a sentimental piece of jewellery and phoned the hotel 4 times to ask them to check the room and follow up for me and was told they would check the next day (I even told them where it would be!). A week has gone past and I am still waiting! Definitely wouldn't return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: deeandrob
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 7th - 11th June 2009 with my partner and our 11 year old son. We found the hotel and staff really nice & pleasant. The only minor problem (which is purely our fault for not doing more research into the area) was the distance from Darling Harbour, Harbour Bridge etc. Normally this wouldn't have been a problem as we are quite keen walkers but i had slipped a disc in my back and long walks were totally out of the question which meant we had to reply on taxis!! Saying this they weren't that expensive and the hotel reception arranged them for us when we requested. We only ate in the hotel once and this was for breakfast which i must say was really enjoyable and guests had quite a lot of choice. We never had any problems with the hot water or tv not working properly and the room was clean and tidy when we arrived. All in all i would say that we really enjoyed our time staying at this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever stay....”
Reviews.Author: Broohar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 2 children have just returned from a nights accomodation at Rydges North Sydney. Where do I start, it would have to be the worst place we have stayed at ever. We opened the door to our room to be greeted by the horrible smell of cigarette smoke throughout the whole place. We were actually in a non smoking room but i guess the last guests didn't abide by those regulations. There was no point asking for a room change as at check in earlier it was noted that there were no rooms left available. We ventured to the hotel restaurant for dinner with another family of 4 who were also staying there. They too had issues with their room, TV not working (fixed by staff after an hour), Fridge broken couldn't be fixed so they were offered ice buckets ???? They told us that the carpet was dirty in their room as well, after losing a small childs toy they ran their hands over the carpet looking for the toy only to find fingernails and chewed up biscuit from previous guests !! Anyway after being seated for dinner we then had to wait 1 hr 20 minutes before any of our meals turned up, numerous other diners seated nearby looked just as angry as us and several complaints as well as ours were given to staff. When the chefs were asked if our kids meals were ready they then started cooking them which took all of 5 minutes, by this stage the children were all getting a bit feral as no dinner by 8.30 pm was a bit more than they could handle. Overall the whole stay at Rydges North Sydney was very disappointing, a pleasant relaxing time that we were expecting wasn't had by all. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm hotel with new TV's that don't really work”
Reviews.Author: explorer_360
Reviews.Content: Had booked in for 5 nights during the easter long weekend, but only stayed for 4 (paid for 5). Booked through the Rydges website as a member. Price I paid (booked way in advanced) was a bargain at $99.00/night for a queen bed room. Parking costs $15.00/night in their secure car park. I parked on the street behind the hotel for 3 nights and then 1 night in the secure car park. The hotel itself is ok. Things are a bit dated, but overall acceptable. The lifts have been renovated. The room I stayed in was on a high floor and had a great view. The room itself looked exactly like it did in the pictures on the Rydges website. The mini bar fridge was very big and empty(just the way I like it). The carpets could have done with a steam clean/ been replaced. The bathroom had been repainted, but really needed a renovation. The paper cup place holders near the bathroom sink looked like they had not been changed for ages and had been reused over and over. The hotel had problems with the hot water for most of my stay. Like all other Rydges Hotels, the bed was very comforatble. The new flat screen TV was... fantastic... except if the sound on it actually worked. I had called the reception about this problem every day of my stay. The first time I enquired I was told it would be fixed. Went out to dinner, came back, TV sound worked.... for a few minutes. I had to call reception every day regarding the TV as the sound did not work. They would tell me to reset the TV, which I kept on telling them didn't do anything to solve my problem. There was one night in particular that I need to mention. I had come back very late that night after dinner in the city. I called reception at around 12midnight. There were only 2 people on night shift. The staff member that came up at 12midnight was very courteous and tried to do everything that he could for me at that time of night to try and fix the sound problem on the TV. Being a long-weekend, there was really nothing that could be done, and changing rooms was out of the question as the hotel was fully booked out. The staff member was the most pleasant and corteous person that I have encountered at a Rydges Hotel. Apart from this very nice staff member, the hotel was a very painful experience. Try showering in luke warm water for 3 nights in a row and coming back to a room with a TV that doesn't have any sound. Check-out at around 7pm was just as unpleasant, but unlike everything else, the problem was sorted out on the spot. I ended up checking out about 15hrs earlier than what I had planned as I had had enough. I have stayed in other Rydges Hotels before without any problems. This is by far the worst experience I have ever had with a Rydges chain hotel (which is very unusual for a Rydges Hotel). If this hotel fixes all its niggly problems, this would have been a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2009
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rydges North Sydney in a 'Parkview Queen Room'. The outside of the hotel is a little tired but once inside it was fine. My room was nice and spacious with a large window, flat screen tv and very comfortable bed. The bathroom was tired and could do with an upgrade but besides that I was very happy with my room. All staff I encountered were very friendly and most helpful (reception, breakfast and bar staff). I had breakfast downstairs in the restaurant on a few mornings and was very pleased with the selection. As well as offering room service for breakfast they also offer a take away service which can be ordered the night before. The hotel offers a free shuttle service which runs within a 5km area and the hotel is in a great location, 5-8 minute walk to the North Sydney CBD. If travelling on business I would definately stay at the Rydges again.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK, if you don't mind...”
Reviews.Author: Unsatisfied12
Reviews.Content: My children gave my partner and I a gift voucher for the Twilight Concert with an accommodation package at Rydges North Sydney. It was a lovely thought, from our children, but if they realised what they had sent us to I don't think they would be very impressed! As I have read in past reviews, the lukewarm water is still evident and nothing has been done to rectify this. I had the second shower after my husband and the water was not only lukewarm, but merely a trickle. No pressure!!! I have long hair and didn't bother to condition it as there was barely any water. The air conditioning was very noisy and wouldn't turn off! I called reception, about 9pm. A rude young madam attended my room promptly, but couldn't find the switch. So couldn't find the problem and didn't offer any alternative!! My husband later found the switch was behind the headboard, after he rolled the bed out. The concert was wonderful and I am attending another package in the up comming weekends. If I hadn't already prepaid for this package, I would definately like to cancel and book accommodation elsewhere. The bed was comfortable, but a pity everything else let it down. I don't look forward to my upcomming return! One last thing, the mould in the bathrooms are still very present! I will get photos from my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired”
Reviews.Author: BT2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rydges North Sydney to compliment our trip to the Concert at the Taronga Zoo Series. Staff where pleasant upon check in but once in our room very disappointed by the very tired dÃ©cor. The wardrobe doors did not close properly due to broken hinges, the refrigerator leaking in to the cupboard and onto the carpet. The ensuite could use some mould remover and as per other reviews lukewarm water from the shower. Sunday morning looking forward to a bit of a sleep in when the housekeeping staff walk into the room at 9:30 check out was 11:00. After the apology they exited but went into the room next door talking to each other, vacuuming and banging around. Not very relaxing so we got up and left. On a positive note the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, if they have hot water.”
Reviews.Author: paulkiddoc
Reviews.Content: We have been to Sydney twice before - love it! This time, we have a niece and family living north of the city. We decided to stay at the Rydges North Sydney because it would be walking distance to the harbor north of the Sydney Bridge, where we wanted to watch the fireworks on New Year's Eve. It was a great decision. It was about a 20 minute walk to a nice park along the harbor. It was a wonderful experience. As for the hotel, it was in a very quiet neighborhood. The room was nice, with a view of Sydney Harbor (but not the bridge). Breakfast was included, the people were nice, and the bed was comfortable. The only problem was that there was no hot water at all - for the 3 nights we were there. They were sorry, but did nothing to solve the problem, which they said was due to the fact that the hotel was full. Humm, you'd think they'd be prepared for such a strange event. They said they were going to meet to discuss this issue. They also did absolutely nothing in term of lowering our rate, offering us a free night, etc. Contrast that with the Hilton Corporation - see my review of the Fiji Spa and Resort Managed by Hilton (which I'll post soon). So, I recommend Rydges North Sydney with "reservations" - make sure they have hot water!

Reviews.Title: “A Lukewarm Shower”
Reviews.Author: Coastalgal99
Reviews.Content: I had a lukewarm shower. I told reception, who responsed they had no complaints. The shower continued to be lukewarm. When I checked out and mentioned this issue, I was only given an apology and informed the front line manager will phone the next day. They are only all smiles when you pay. The bathroom would gain from a good bleach and scrub.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Travelpretties
Reviews.Content: In October for Labor Day weekend my family and I stayed at Rydges North Sydney. 3 Adults stayed in I think 'waterview suite', basically it was a one bedroom suite with a large sitting room. (Refer to pictures). The front desk staff were helpful and there was no complaints in the way they handled our check in. The room was spacious and fairly clean, now Rydges isn't a five star hotel and i think its unfair to compare it to one but I was pretty impressed with the overall quality of the rooms. There are two plasma tv, one in the bedroom and one in the livingroom. There was plenty of towels but not as fluffy and soft as I like them to be. I guess after reading all the negative reviews I was kinda expecting a really rundown and dirty hotel so it was a pleasant surprise. Room service was efficient, althought the prawn on skewers and bed of jasmine rice wasn't so tasty. The underground parking is a bit bland, yes its good value but I don't feel safe when I park my car there (the lighting isnt so good) It was also disappointing the bar downstairs closed at 10pm on a weekend! During our stay we had breakfast @ the hotel, the buffet was simple and it was nice to have freshly made smoothies and 'real' coffee made by baristas. Overall it wasn't a bad experience and I would stay at Rydges again.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as Lamb!!”
Reviews.Author: Musrag
Reviews.Content: My title says it all..... I recently stayed again at this hotel for work. It has been about 4 years since I stayed here and back then after a few compulsory stays for work I changed as it was old and needed a good overhaul. Unfortunately staying there again has shown me other then adding a larger tv to the room nothing has changed. The rooms are old, the bathroom is just terrible. Water pressure or lack of it was a joke, the mould, cracks and dirty areas made it a shocking sight. Mini Bar was overpriced with a small chocolate bar being $4.50. The TV was very slow between channels - a 3 - 5 sec period before it changes - it did freeze on one channel and would not even turn off. Reception said to turn off and leave off for 7 mins as it happens all the time in all the rooms. Beware if ironing as well as dirty and may leak and stain your clothes... One good thing is the bed and pillows were comfy in my room. Staff were very friendly and professional and should be in a better class of hotel as they did well by me. Go to the Vibe in Nth Sydney - great location and very trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Good beds, avoid the room service pizza.”
Reviews.Author: blorty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rydges for a week in June. My party was spread over four floors. Problems (not purely the fault of the hotel) began at check-in. We had not decided who was staying with whom, so I checked into a room with two others and soon found out (from the staff) that a room under our party's name was empty, so I took advantage of this. What followed was a slapstick-style jump up and down from floor to floor only to find myself (after more than an hour of going back and forth between floor) back in the original room. Before I left for Sydney I read some reviews saying the beds are the best thing about the hotel. I remember thinking "Oh there has to be more to it than just the beds." No, not really. Apart from the hotel's proximity to the theatre we were working in, there was nothing else much to Rydges. The service was ordinary, the hot water pressure was the WORST I've ever experienced and the room service pizza tasted like it had been boiled. I would have gladly eaten elsewhere but Nth Sydney shuts down at 5pm, with little exception. Good Guinness pie at the Rag & Famish, and a GREAT massaman curry at the Thai place next to the Independent Theatre on Miller St...but if you're after more than a very comfy bed, avoid Rydges N Syd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & average!”
Reviews.Author: AMADKRA
Reviews.Content: Rydges North Sydney was quite a nice hotel. It is a little off the beaten track however my partner and I travelled into the Sydney CBD on a daily basis with no issues. An advantage to this though is that the hotel is very quiet - no road noise etc whatsoever. We always felt safe walking back at night, however if you were by yourself I am sure it would be fine, but might not feel that way! The hotel itself has a nice lobby. The room was nice and average size (don't expect any views). The bathroom was reasonably clean. We stayed for three nights and on the first day the hairdryer literally blew up (well it smoked and died anyway). I rang reception to get it fixed straight away. It was still not fixed by the time we checked out (I rang a couple more times during the stay as well). That did tarnish the stay a bit (more so if I relied heavily on a hairdryer!), and to be honest reception really did not seem to care. They were not 'rude', but they were not interested in the least either which is a shame. I would recommend this hotel only if you don't mind walking AND you get it for a good rate (or need or prefer a North Sydney location). Otherwise Sydney has plenty of other options available that I believe would be more satisfying. I doubt I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: rose2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I together with our 2 children stayed in this hotel recently and were impressed at the fantastic value for money. We took up one of their family packages to Taronga Zoo which included accom, family entry to the zoo, buffet breakfast and parking - ALL for an amazing price. The staff were great, the rooms were fine, maybe needing some maintenance repairs if anything and the breakfast was really really good. The staff fussed over our children and were attentive to our needs as a family. For a family getaway to Sydney I can't really fault this hotel and we will return.

HotelInfo.Name: Rydges North Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 54 McLaren St, Sydney, New South Wales 2060, Australia
